# Chord: add4 in D (Shape: G)

## Brief Description
The add4 chord is a variation of a traditional triad chord in which the fourth degree of the scale is added to the chord. In this case, the add4 chord in the key of D played in the shape of a G chord includes the notes D, G, A, and B.

## Notes and Intervals
- D (Root)
- G (Perfect 4th)
- A (Perfect 5th)
- B (Major 6th/13th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The add4 chord in D (Shape: G) is often used in various genres to create a dreamy or ethereal musical atmosphere. It adds a sense of tension and color to a progression, giving a more open and ambient sound compared to a standard triad chord. It is commonly found in progressive rock, dream pop, and jazz music.

## Songs
1. **"Yellow" by Coldplay**: The intro of this hit song features an add4 chord in D (Shape: G), creating a bright and optimistic tone.
   
2. **"The Less I Know The Better" by Tame Impala**: This modern indie rock hit uses the add4 chord in D (Shape: G) to enhance the psychedelic vibe of the song.

3. **"Just the Two of Us" by Grover Washington Jr. & Bill Withers**: In this smooth jazz classic, the add4 chord in D (Shape: G) adds a lush and sophisticated harmonic color to the arrangement.
